name: pitifulness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of making people feel sympathy, or of being full of sympathy: The scene sums up all the sadness and darkness and pitifulness of human existence. He looked at me with a sort of dignified pitifulness. See
pitiful
More examplesFewer examplesIt's a pitiful episode, though put in perspective by the greater pitifulness of the war.The pitifulness of his disabilities can only be appreciated by wide reading of his correspondence.She remembered everything good about him, and began to weep for the pitifulness of his life and death.
